org.openimaj.stream.provider.twitter

Class AbstractTwitterSearchDataset<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.util.stream.AbstractStream<T>
      • org.openimaj.util.stream.BlockingDroppingBufferedStream<T>
        • org.openimaj.stream.provider.twitter.AbstractTwitterSearchDataset<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Type of items in the stream
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<T>, Iterator<T>, Dataset<T>, StreamingDataset<T>, Stream<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ContextRoundRobinTwitterSearchAPIDataset, RoundRobinTwitterSearchAPIDataset, TwitterSearchDataset

    public abstract class AbstractTwitterSearchDataset<T>
extends BlockingDroppingBufferedStream<T>
implements StreamingDataset<T>
    Calls the SearchResource.search(Query) function periodically and offers all discovered Status instances with the underlying BlockingDroppingBufferedStream. This stream initially takes all search results available and then attempts to retrieve results which occurred after the latest Tweet seen. Apart form this, this Stream makes no special efforts to:
    • stop duplicate items
    • stop when a search returns nothing
    • remove retweets or spam.
    These must all be handled externally!

    This class is abstract in terms of the object the stream consumes. Instances of this class can construct the specific object they require for each twitter status using:

    • the query that created it
    • the status object
    • the raw json of the status
    Author:
    Sina Samangooei (ss@ecs.soton.ac.uk)
